div1.p: Lida writes about enjoying her vacation.

div1.head: Postcard from Lida [s.n.] to Mary and Philip Showalter Hench, August 20, 1941
div1.opener:
THIS SPACE FOR WRITING MESSAGES
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
INDUSTRY AGRICULTURE
FOR DEFENSE
POSTAGE
POST CARD
BEACH HAVEN
AUG 20
10 AM
1941
Dr. and Mrs. P. S. Hench
517 fourth St. S. W.
Rochester
Minn.
div1.p:
We really had a
good trip over here. We
mislaid the tidy seat
once but the kids were
amazingly good for them
and once we get caught up
on our sleep we ought to
have fun. The beach is
lovely. The hotel is a
typical seaside affair
with sand in the corridors
and old ladies on the
front porch. I had a wire
from Eddie saying they had
no hay fever or car sickness and
had reached Rapid City.
div1.closer: Love Lida “TICHNOR QUALITY VIEWS” REG. U.S. PAT. OFF. MADE ONLY BY TICHNOR BROS., INC., BOSTON, MASS.
